content: the bedford scarf a super cuddly scarf that is impossible to lose one end slips through the other to give the impression and feeling of being knotted but without the bulk one size fits most children between 3months and 3years of age the other extra special advantage is that it should only take a few hours from start to finish i make no particular recommendations as to the yarn you use but as this scarf fits so closely to the neck choose your yarn thoughtfully yarns that are too fluffy or scratchy will irritate for this sample i have used cleckheaton s merino angora silk 8ply in grey the bedford scarf materials 50g ball of 8ply dk - you will use around half 4mm needles us 6 - plain or double-pointed stitch holder or scrap yarn in contrasting colour yarn needle to weave in ends pattern notes gauge 24 stitches 35 row for a 10cm 4in square finished dimensions total length 55cm 21 5in approx body 30cm 12in approx and width 10cm 4in approx 1st tail cast 22 stitches on using the long tail method knit 30 row in garter st remembering to slip the first stitch of every row remove every 2nd stitch to the back onto a stitch holder or scrap yarn you now have 11 active stitches and 11 stored stitches do make sure that you will commence ribbing from the right side or the outside of what will become the loop k1 p1 five times k1 p1 k1 five times p1 continue to rib in this way for 13 row in total break off a generous tail and move these stitches to a stitch holder or scrap yarn pick up previously stored stitches so that your first ribbed row will be worked from the wrong side or the inside of what will become the loop with a new yarn* repeat the 13 row of ribbing but commence with the p1 k1 row your tails should both fall on the same side of your work before closing this loop you may wish to weave in the tail from your new yarn* knit all 22 stitches back onto one needle alternating as you go body knit in garter st continue to slip the first stitch of each garter row until body section measures approximately 30cm 2nd tail repeat the 1st tail exactly in reverse cast off weave in ends and get that baby wrapped up
